We are pleased to announce an exciting direct hire career opportunity for a Principal Database Administrator at our client’s organization in Roswell, GA. Candidates MUST have: 10+ years of experience Expert-level knowledge in Oracle Database technologies and Microsoft SQL Server USC or GC only Must already be located within driving distance to Roswell, GA 30075. The client will not accept any candidates who need to relocate for hybrid work.

Title: Principal Database Administrator
Duration: Full-Time Employee (FTE)
Direct Hire Salary: Disclose later + benefits (no bonus)
Work Location: 1035 Alpharetta Street, Roswell, GA 30075
Hybrid (On-site/remote): 3 days on-site / 2 days remote
Visa Status: US Citizen or Green Card Only, the client cannot sponsor any visas at this time
Reports to: DBA Manager
Client Req #: JA #1008566

Please submit Word.doc Resume, Photo ID and/or LinkedIn Full Legal Name:
First: Middle: Last: Email Address: Telephone Number #: Current Location: [City, State] Availability for the assignment: Communication Skills Rating (1-10): Available face-to-face interview in 1035 Alpharetta Street, Roswell, GA 30075 (Yes/No): Commitment to On-Site/Hybrid Work from assignment start: [Yes/No] Last 4 Digits of SSN (For All Other Clients): Date of Birth (Month/Day): Status and Expiry Date (Month/Year): Education Background for Bachelors & Masters (Must be Reflected on Resume) Degree, Field of Study, Educational Institution, Graduation Date, Month/Year

As the most senior member of the DBA team, the Principal Database Administrator will be responsible for architecting, managing, and optimizing the organization’s database infrastructure. This role requires expert-level technical proficiency in database administration, particularly with Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server, along with specialized expertise in Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) administration and configuration.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide mentorship to other DBA team members while managing the architecture, administration, monitoring, and optimization of databases for optimal performance.
Oversee complex installation, configuration, upgrades, and patching of Oracle RAC and Microsoft SQL Server HA clusters.
Design and implement high-availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) strategies aligned with business needs.
Collaborate with application teams to enhance EBS application performance and support deployment processes while ensuring compliance.

Key Qualifications:
10+ years of hands-on database administration experience with expert-level knowledge in Oracle Database technologies and Microsoft SQL Server.
Extensive experience with Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) and strong understanding of SOX compliance.
Proficiency in database security, encryption, and regulatory compliance.
A Bachelor’s degree in information technology or a related field is preferred.

Working Environment:
This position offers a flexible working environment, allowing for remote work, while also requiring on-site collaboration three days a week.

If you are interested in this opportunity and believe you meet the qualifications outlined above, please reply to this email with your updated resume or feel free to reach out with any questions. We look forward to connecting with you soon! E-mail is the best way to reach me, if I don’t pick your call.
